fixes.name: Loss Flag
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF to DAX IF. This is row-level logic checking Profit per row, so created as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Discount Amount
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the row-level multiplication [Sales]*[Discount] to a DAX calculated column using table[column] references.

fixes.name: Discount Health
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the row-level division [Discount Amount]/[Sales] to DAX. Uses the previously defined Discount Amount calculated column; remains a calculated column.

fixes.name: Discount Tier
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.25,
    "High Discount",
    IF(
        'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Health] > 0.10,
        "Medium Discount",
        "Low Discont"
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated nested Tableau IF/ELSEIF to nested DAX IF calls. This is row-level classification based on Discount Health, so implemented as a calculated column.

fixes.name: Failure Risk
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Loss Flag] = 1 && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Discount Tier] = "High Discount ",
    "High Risk",
    "Low Risk"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF with AND to DAX IF using &&. References Loss Flag and Discount Tier calculated columns; remains a row-level calculated column.

fixes.name: Alert Flag
fixes.dax_expression:
IF(
    'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Rank Category ] = "Tier 3" && 'Orders+ (Sample - Superstore)'[Failure Risk] = "High Risk",
    "Alert",
    "Normal"
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau IF condition to DAX IF with &&. This is row-level logic depending on Rank Category and Failure Risk, so implemented as a calculated column.
